item.title: Maygrove Road entrance to the Peace Park, 15th July
item.description:
The signpost directing people to Sidings Community Centre has broken off and needs to be replaced. I am a Trustee of Sidings and we are keen to ensure that the people of West Hampstead know of the services available here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Maygrove Road, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: London plane tree in need of pruning - front of 56A Sundridge Av., 15th July
item.description:
The plane tree outside 56a Sundridge Avenue is in need of pruning. There is a meaningful amount of branch debris that lands in the front garden and driveway of 56a Sundridge Avenue on a regular basis. Can you please have this actioned as soon as possible? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Box junction required - serious accident will happen, 15th July
item.description:
The intersection of Albert Gate/Knightsbridge is an accident waiting to happen for cyclists and pedestrians. I cycle to and from work every day and each morning/night cars/trucks/buses stop in the middle of the intersection causing the lights on the far side to be blocked from view. Pedestrians & Cyclists then cross by weaving around traffic on a green light, however the other side might have gone red and I have seen so many near misses. If there was a box junction here, it would act as a deterrent to block the road & create revenue for the council, but more so prevent injury or death of someone.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Knightsbridge, Brompton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near bin on street/green square, 15th July
item.description:
Bags of domestic water dumped containing a Large amount of rotting chicken wings/meat. Covered in flies and attracting vermen. Fould smelling and our kids cannot play in the green square as a result. Please please please come and clean it up. ...this is a regular occurrence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sunray Avenue, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown communal garden and dirty pavement, 15th July
item.description:
Hi Communal area has overgrown and pavement is blocked and dirty. It need clearup and hedges trimmed and cut. The entrance is via Beatrice road behind Kotree way and St. James Road. We pay service charge but no service takes place. Please see pictures attached. It is dangerous to walk here.

item.description:

item.title: Need cutting as previous message, 15th July
item.description:
In reply to request earlier today. In my opinion it is a health and safety risk. Many branches have fallen recently. The branches are extremely heavy. Not to mention rising pavement from roots. I live near the tree in question and have a disabled child. Navigating around the lumps/bumps and ducking extremely heavy branches. The tree is also overhanging the road so when trucks/bin Lorrie’s come, they’re bashing the tree loosening these heavy branches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villiers Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven paving slabs, dropped kerbs too steep or broken, potholes, 15th July
item.description:
The whole road and pavement are in desperate need of repair, because of uneven paving slabs and potholes. I couldn't use any part of this road to get to the shop with my mobility scooter, as the dropped kerbs are too steep, with some that are broken or have cobbles at the base, which I can't climb with my scooter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shawbrooke Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
